BiblioData.Title: SEMICONDUCTOR LIGHT EMITTING DEVICE WITH LATERAL CURRENT INJECTION IN THE LIGHT EMITTING REGION
BiblioData.Abstract: A semiconductor light emitting device includes an active region, an n-type region, and a p-type region comprising a portion that extends into the active region. The active region may include multiple quantum wells separated by barrier layers, and the p-type extension penetrates at least one of the quantum well layers. The extensions of the p-type region into the active region may provide uniform filling of carriers in the individual quantum wells of the active region by providing direct current paths into individual quantum wells. Such uniform filling may improve the operating efficiency at high current density by reducing the carrier density in the quantum wells closest to the bulk p-type region, thereby reducing the number of carriers lost to nonradiative recombination.

Claims.P: What is being claimed is:
1. A semiconductor light emitting device comprising;
an n-type region;
an active region configured to emit light; and
a p-type region, wherein the p-type region comprises at least one extension that extends into the active region.
2. The device of claim 1 wherein the active region comprises at least one III-nitride layer.
3. The device of claim 1 wherein the active region comprises at least two quantum well layers separated by at least one barrier layer.
4. The device of claim 3 wherein the extension penetrates at least one of the quantum well layers.
5. The device of claim 1 wherein the extension has a width between 250 nm and 1000 nm.
6. The device of claim 1 wherein the active region is adjacent to the n-type region, wherein the extension extends through the active region to within 100 nm of the n-type region.
7. The device of claim 1 wherein the extension has a depth between 200 nm and 1000 nm.
8. The device of claim 1 wherein the extension has a depth between 400 nm and 600 nm.

9. The device of claim 1 wherein the at least one extension is a first extension, the device further comprising a second extension that extends into the active region, wherein the first extension and the second extension are spaced between 0.3 micron and ten microns apart.

10. The device of claim 1 wherein the at least one extension is a first extension, the device further comprising a second extension that extends into the active region, wherein the first extension and the second extension are spaced between one micron and three microns apart.
11. The device of claim 1 wherein:
the p-type region has a top surface;
the at least one extension into the active region extends from a first portion of the top surface; and
a second portion of the top surface is without an extension into the active region;

the device further comprising a semiconductor layer formed over the second portion, the semiconductor layer being not intentionally doped or having a dopant concentration less than a dopant concentration in the p-type region.
12. The device of claim 11 wherein the semiconductor layer is GaN that is not intentionally doped.
13. The device of claim 1 wherein:
the p-type region has a top surface;
the at least one extension into the active region extends from a first portion of the top surface; and
a second portion of the top surface is without an extension into the active region;
the device further comprising a semiconductor layer formed over the second portion, the semiconductor layer having a band gap greater than a band gap in the p-type region.
14. The device of claim 13 wherein the semiconductor layer is AlGaN.
15. The device of claim 1 further comprising:
first and second contacts electrically connected to the n-type region and the p-type region;
leads electrically connected to the first and second contacts; and
a transparent cover disposed over the active region.
16. A method comprising:
forming a semiconductor structure comprising an active region disposed between an n-type region and a p-type region, the active region comprising at least one III-nitride layer; and
forming an extension of the p-type region which extends into the active region.
17. The method of claim 16 wherein forming an extension comprises:
growing a pit defect in at least a portion of the active region; and
providing p-type material which fills in the pit defect.
18. The method of claim 17 further comprising etching the pit defect prior to providing p-type material.
19. The method of claim 16 wherein forming an extension comprises diffusing p-type dopant into a portion of the active region.
20. The method of claim 16 wherein forming an extension comprises implanting p-type dopant into a portion of the active region.
21. The method of claim 16 wherein forming an extension comprises:
etching away a portion of the active region; and
providing p-type material which fills in the etched portion.
